stimulusHtml: Which of the following best explains the importance of the East Indies in the European-dominated trade networks of the 1600s and 1700s?

features.html: The following question refers to the topic of global markets in the 1600s and 1700s.

choicesHtml: The region offered control of sailing routes to Australia and the Pacific islands.
The region was a source of spices and other luxury goods for the European market.
The region was a source of staple foodstuffs that supplied Europeâ€™s growing population.
The region provided sites for Europeans to establish large settler colonies.
